verb.description: Prepare (written material) for publication by correcting, condensing, or otherwise modifying it.
examples: Volume I was edited by J. Johnson

verb.description: Be editor of (a newspaper or magazine).

noun.description: A change or correction made as a result of editing.

origin: Late 18th century (as a verb): partly a back-formation from editor, reinforced by French éditer to edit (from édition edition).
